Package environment

States, Actions and Game Rules.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ArrayOfActions For ElementaryAgentsWithNeighbours : maintain a list of the agent neighbours last actions.
IAction Minimal behavior of a generic Action.
IEnvironment The game's rules : Gives the list of possible actions from a given state.
IEnvironmentSingle  
IEnvironmentTwoPlayers  
IState  
ITwoPlayerState Methods for a Generic State.
TileAbleEnvironment When the problem can be solved with tiling
 

Class Summary
AbstractComposedAction Composed actions are used in the multi-agent case : an abstract composed action stores elementary actions, together with the elementary agent applying this action : the goal is to be able to find what action a given agent performed.
AbstractEnvironmentSingle For the moment (september 2005,USTL ), graphical interface is only provided for one player game/puzzles : this class defines the minimal behaviour of a universe in which graphical display is possible.
AbstractState Wrapping Interface State and define some common behaviors.
AbstractTwoPlayerState Wrapping Interface State and define some common behaviors.
ActionList A place to put actions : used when looking for the list of possible moves.
ComposedActionArrayList A container of elementary Agent actions, using an ArrayList to store and retrieve elementary actions
ComposedActionHashMap  
ElementaryMultiAgentEnvironment This kind of environments is only able to produce a list of possible actions : all other computations are made inside a MultiAgentEnvironment
ExtendedStateWithActions<F extends IState,E extends NullableAction> For ElementaryCooperativeAgents : a local state is composed of : The limited vision (perception) of the global environment state.
Filter  
NullableAction  
 

Package environment Description

States, Actions and Game Rules. All of this must be instantiated for each given problem or game.
